document.docAuthor: Abrams, Kym M., Huey, Joel A., Hillyer, Mia J., Didham, Raphael K. & Harvey, Mark S.
document.masterDocTitle: A systematic revision of Draculoides (Schizomida: Hubbardiidae) of the Pilbara, Western Australia, Part I: the Western Pilbara

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A systematic revision of Draculoides (Schizomida: Hubbardiidae) of the Pilbara, Western Australia, Part I: the Western Pilbara

taxonomicName.emphasis: Draculoides bythius ( Harvey, Berry, Edward and Humphreys, 2008 )

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Paradraculoides bythius Harvey, Berry, Edward and Humphreys 2008: 187–188
, figs. 1–3, 10, 36–42.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Draculoides bythius (Harvey, Berry, Edward and Humphreys)
:
Abrams et al . 2019
MPE 106532: 8, fig. 2.

materialsCitation.collectorName: M. Greenham & D. Kamien & L. Mould

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype male.
AUSTRALIA :
Western Australia
: Mesa B (Borehole 0016, trap 3), 37.9 km W of Pannawonica , 21°39’49”S , 115°57’2”E ,
1 June 2005
, M. Greenham , D. Kamien and L. Mould ( WAM
T 63364
).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Other material. AUSTRALIA :
Western Australia
: See
Harvey et al . (2008)
;
Abrams et al . (2019)
.

Diagnosis. The shape of the male flagellum of
Draculoides bythius
most closely resembles
D. affinis , D. anachoretus
,
D. cochranus
,
D. eremius
,
D. gnophicola
,
D. kryptus
,
D. mckechnieorum
,
D. noctigrassator
and
D. warramboo ,
especially in the presence of a broad base. It differs from
D. affinis
,
D. eremius and D. gnophicola
in the presence of a distally tapered end (blunt end in the aforementioned species). It differs from
D. anachoretus
,
D. cochranus
,
D. mckechnieorum
,
D. noctigrassator
and
D. warramboo
in the position of dm4 being in line with dl3, dm4 is anterior to dl 3 in the aforementioned species. It differs from
D. kryptus
in the anterior position of dm 4 in relation to dl3 (dm4 posterior to dl 3 in
D. kryptus
). Females of this species differ from all other females by the position of microsetae between the two most anterior flagellomere of the flagellum.
Draculoides bythius
can be diagnosed from all other
Draculoides
species that were sequenced at COI and 12S by the 50bp mini-barcodes shown in Figures 3 and 5 .
Draculoides bythius
can be diagnosed from all other
Draculoides
species that were sequenced at ITS2 ( Fig. 7 ) except for
Draculoides anachoretus
,
D. eremius
,
D. gnophicola
,
D. kryptus
,
D. mckechnieorum
,
D. warramboo
,
D. immortalis
,
D. belalugosii
,
D. christopherleei
,
D. piscivultus
and
D. akashae ,
which are not distinguishable using the ITS2 mini-barcode.

Remarks .
Draculoides bythius
is found in Mesas B and C situated west of Pannawonica in the Pilbara region of Western Australia ( Fig. 1A ).
